TopicTitle: Question about the dimensions of the Mk1-2 Command Pod

Articles.Content:
Hey Guys,

I'm building a model for a mod, and I need to put a hatch on it that is the same size as the one on the Mk1-2 Command Pod. Can anyone tell me what the exact size of that hatch is?

[IMG]http://t1.gstatic.com/images?q=tbn:ANd9GcTq6bFajdIFfeAgGwry_KtfgJDthua4_KCpOfZ0jhOryIvSdkfP[/IMG]

I'm also looking to find out the size of the standard exterior hatch.

[IMG]http://i61.tinypic.com/jj5x5v.png[/IMG]

Any information you can provide would be appreciated. Thanks in advance.

[quote name='Venusgate']Like... pixel count?[/QUOTE]

No, actually. Meters is what I'm looking for.

Well, the Mk1 lander pod's hatch is 0.667 high x 0.60775 wide. That one was easy to measure by importing into blender.

The Mk1-2 capsule isn't so easy, since the hatch is textured on. The grab-handles on the left/right sides of the hatch are roughly 0.5 or 0.6 apart.

The Mk1-2 capsule isn't so easy, since the hatch is textured on. The grab-handles on the left/right sides of the hatch are roughly 0.5 or 0.6 apart.[/QUOTE]

Thanks. That should give me a good enough idea. I would've opened it up in Blender if I had to, but I'm still trying to figure Blender out (I do my modelling in Maya), so I figured I'd turn to the forums first and see if I could get it that way. Again, thanks.
